column2: Alma 29:3 3 But behold, I am a man, and do sin in my wish; for I ought to be content with the things which the Lord hath allotted unto me.
column3: Alma twenty nine to three three But behold, I am a man, and do sin in my wish; for I ought to be content with the things which the Lord hath allotted unto me.

column2: Alma 29:4 4 I ought not to harrow up in my desires, the firm decree of a just God, for I know that he granteth unto men according to their desire, whether it be unto death or unto life; yea, I know that he allotteth unto men, yea, decreeth unto them decrees which are unalterable, according to their wills, whether they be unto salvation or unto destruction.
column3: Alma twenty nine to four four I ought not to harrow up in my desires, the firm decree of a just God, for I know that he granteth unto men according to their desire, whether it be unto death or unto life; yea, I know that he allotteth unto men, yea, decreeth unto them decrees which are unalterable, according to their wills, whether they be unto salvation or unto destruction.

column2: Alma 29:5 5 Yea, and I know that good and evil have come before all men; he that knoweth not good from evil is blameless; but he that knoweth good and evil, to him it is given according to his desires, whether he desireth good or evil, life or death, joy or remorse of conscience.
column3: Alma twenty nine to five five Yea, and I know that good and evil have come before all men; he that knoweth not good from evil is blameless; but he that knoweth good and evil, to him it is given according to his desires, whether he desireth good or evil, life or death, joy or remorse of conscience.

column2: Alma 29:6 6 Now, seeing that I know these things, why should I desire more than to perform the work to which I have been called?
column3: Alma twenty nine to six six Now, seeing that I know these things, why should I desire more than to perform the work to which I have been called?

column2: Alma 29:7 7 Why should I desire that I were an angel, that I could speak unto all the ends of the earth?
column3: Alma twenty nine to seven seven Why should I desire that I were an angel, that I could speak unto all the ends of the earth?

column2: Alma 29:8 8 For behold, the Lord doth grant unto all nations, of their own nation and tongue, to teach his word, yea, in wisdom, all that he seeth fit that they should have; therefore we see that the Lord doth counsel in wisdom, according to that which is just and true.
column3: Alma twenty nine to eight eight For behold, the Lord doth grant unto all nations, of their own nation and tongue, to teach his word, yea, in wisdom, all that he seeth fit that they should have; therefore we see that the Lord doth counsel in wisdom, according to that which is just and true.

column2: Alma 29:9 9 I know that which the Lord hath commanded me, and I glory in it.
column3: Alma twenty nine to nine nine I know that which the Lord hath commanded me, and I glory in it.

column2: I do not glory of myself, but I glory in that which the Lord hath commanded me; yea, and this is my glory, that perhaps I may be an instrument in the hands of God to bring some soul to repentance; and this is my joy.
column3: I do not glory of myself, but I glory in that which the Lord hath commanded me; yea, and this is my glory, that perhaps I may be an instrument in the hands of God to bring some soul to repentance; and this is my joy.

column2: Alma 29:10 10 And behold, when I see many of my brethren truly penitent, and coming to the Lord their God, then is my soul filled with joy; then do I remember what the Lord has done for me, yea, even that he hath heard my prayer; yea, then do I remember his merciful arm which he extended towards me.
column3: Alma twenty nine to ten ten And behold, when I see many of my brethren truly penitent, and coming to the Lord their God, then is my soul filled with joy; then do I remember what the Lord has done for me, yea, even that he hath heard my prayer; yea, then do I remember his merciful arm which he extended towards me.

column2: Alma 29:11 11 Yea, and I also remember the captivity of my fathers; for I surely do know that the Lord did deliver them out of bondage, and by this did establish his church; yea, the Lord God, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did deliver them out of bondage.
column3: Alma twenty nine to eleven eleven Yea, and I also remember the captivity of my fathers; for I surely do know that the Lord did deliver them out of bondage, and by this did establish his church; yea, the Lord God, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did deliver them out of bondage.

column2: Alma 29:12 12 Yea, I have always remembered the captivity of my fathers; and that same God who delivered them out of the hands of the Egyptians did deliver them out of bondage.
column3: Alma twenty nine to twelve twelve Yea ,I have always remembered the captivity of my fathers; and that same God who delivered them out of the hands of the Egyptians did deliver them out of bondage.

column2: Alma 29:13 13 Yea, and that same God did establish his church among them; yea, and that same God hath called me by a holy calling, to preach the word unto this people, and hath given me much success, in the which my joy is full.
column3: Alma twenty nine to thirteen thirteen Yea, and that same God did establish his church among them; yea, and that same God hath called me by a holy calling, to preach the word unto this people, and hath given me much success, in the which my joy is full.

column2: Alma 29:14 14 But I do not joy in my own success alone, but my joy is more full because of the success of my brethren, who have been up to the land of Nephi.
column3: Alma twenty nine to fourteen fourteen But I do not joy in my own success alone, but my joy is more full because of the success of my brethren, who have been up to the land of Nephi.

column2: Alma 29:15 15 Behold, they have labored exceedingly, and have brought forth much fruit; and how great shall be their reward!
column3: Alma twenty nine to fifteen fifteen Behold, they have labored exceedingly, and have brought forth much fruit; and how great shall be their reward!

column2: Alma 29:16 16 Now, when I think of the success of these my brethren my soul is carried away, even to the separation of it from the body, as it were, so great is my joy.
column3: Alma twenty nine to sixteen sixteen Now, when I think of the success of these my brethren my soul is carried away, even to the separation of it from the body, as it were, so great is my joy.

column2: Alma 29:17 17 And now may God grant unto these, my brethren, that they may sit down in the kingdom of God; yea, and also all those who are the fruit of their labors that they may go no more out, but that they may praise him forever.
column3: Alma twenty nine to seventeen seventeen And now may God grant unto these, my brethren, that they may sit down in the kingdom of God; yea, and also all those who are the fruit of their labors that they may go no more out, but that they may praise him forever.

column2: And may God grant that it may be done according to my words, even as I have spoken.
column3: And may God grant that it may be done according to my words, even as I have spoken.

column2: Amen.
column3: Amen.

column2: Alma 30 Chapter 30
column3: Alma thirty Chapter thirty

column2: Alma 30:1 1 Behold, now it came to pass that after the people of Ammon were established in the land of Jershon, yea, and also after the Lamanites were driven out of the land, and their dead were buried by the people of the land--
column3: Alma thirty to one one Behold, now it came to pass that after the people of Ammon were established in the land of Jershon, yea, and also after the Lamanites were driven out of the land, and their dead were buried by the people of the land-

column2: Alma 30:2 2 Now their dead were not numbered because of the greatness of their numbers; neither were the dead of the Nephites numbered--but it came to pass after they had buried their dead, and also after the days of fasting, and mourning, and prayer, (and it was in the sixteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi) there began to be continual peace throughout all the land.
column3: Alma thirty to two two Now their dead were not numbered because of the greatness of their numbers; neither were the dead of the Nephites numbered-but it came to pass after they had buried their dead, and also after the days of fasting, and mourning, and prayer, (and it was in the sixteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi) there began to be continual peace throughout all the land.

column2: Alma 30:3 3 Yea, and the people did observe to keep the commandments of the Lord; and they were strict in observing the ordinances of God, according to the law of Moses; for they were taught to keep the law of Moses until it should be fulfilled.
column3: Alma thirty to three three Yea, and the people did observe to keep the commandments of the Lord; and they were strict in observing the ordinances of God, according to the law of Moses; for they were taught to keep the law of Moses until it should be fulfilled.

column2: Alma 30:4 4 And thus the people did have no disturbance in all the sixteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.
column3: Alma thirty to four four And thus the people did have no disturbance in all the sixteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.

column2: Alma 30:5 5 And it came to pass that in the commencement of the seventeenth year of the reign of the judges, there was continual peace.
column3: Alma thirty to five five And it came to pass that in the commencement of the seventeenth year of the reign of the judges, there was continual peace.

column2: Alma 30:6 6 But it came to pass in the latter end of the seventeenth year, there came a man into the land of Zarahemla, and he was Anti-Christ, for he began to preach unto the people against the prophecies which had been spoken by the prophets, concerning the coming of Christ.
column3: Alma thirty to six six But it came to pass in the latter end of the seventeenth year, there came a man into the land of Zarahemla, and he was Anti Christ, for he began to preach unto the people against the prophecies which had been spoken by the prophets, concerning the coming of Christ.

column2: Alma 30:7 7 Now there was no law against a man's belief; for it was strictly contrary to the commands of God that there should be a law which should bring men on to unequal grounds.
column3: Alma thirty to seven seven Now there was no law against a man's belief; for it was strictly contrary to the commands of God that there should be a law which should bring men on to unequal grounds.

column2: Alma 30:8 8 For thus saith the scripture: Choose ye this day, whom ye will serve.
column3: Alma thirty to eight eight For thus saith the scripture: Choose ye this day, whom ye will serve.

column2: Alma 30:9 9 Now if a man desired to serve God, it was his privilege; or rather, if he believed in God it was his privilege to serve him; but if he did not believe in him there was no law to punish him.
column3: Alma thirty to nine nine Now if a man desired to serve God, it was his privilege; or rather, if he believed in God it was his privilege to serve him; but if he did not believe in him there was no law to punish him.

column2: Alma 30:10 10 But if he murdered he was punished unto death; and if he robbed he was also punished; and if he stole he was also punished; and if he committed adultery he was also punished; yea, for all this wickedness they were punished.
column3: Alma thirty to ten ten But if he murdered he was punished unto death; and if he robbed he was also punished; and if he stole he was also punished; and if he committed adultery he was also punished; yea, for all this wickedness they were punished.

column2: Alma 30:11 11 For there was a law that men should be judged according to their crimes.
column3: Alma thirty to eleven eleven For there was a law that men should be judged according to their crimes.

column2: Nevertheless, there was no law against a man's belief; therefore, a man was punished only for the crimes which he had done; therefore all men were on equal grounds.
column3: Nevertheless, there was no law against a man's belief; therefore, a man was punished only for the crimes which he had done; therefore all men were on equal grounds.

column2: Alma 30:12 12 And this Anti-Christ, whose name was Korihor, (and the law could have no hold upon him) began to preach unto the people that there should be no Christ.
column3: Alma thirty to twelve twelve And this Anti Christ, whose name was Korihor, (and the law could have no hold upon him) began to preach unto the people that there should be no Christ.

column2: And after this manner did he preach, saying:
column3: And after this manner did he preach, saying:

column2: Alma 30:13 13 O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?
column3: Alma thirty to thirteen thirteen O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?

column2: Why do ye look for a Christ?
column3: Why do ye look for a Christ?

column2: For no man can know of anything which is to come.
column3: For no man can know of anything which is to come.

column2: Alma 30:14 14 Behold, these things which ye call prophecies, which ye say are handed down by holy prophets, behold, they are foolish traditions of your fathers.
column3: Alma thirty to fourteen fourteen Behold, these things which ye call prophecies, which ye say are handed down by holy prophets, behold, they are foolish traditions of your fathers.

column2: Alma 30:15 15 How do ye know of their surety?
column3: Alma thirty to fifteen fifteen How do ye know of their surety?

column2: Behold, ye cannot know of things which ye do not see; therefore ye cannot know that there shall be a Christ.
column3: Behold, ye cannot know of things which ye do not see; therefore ye cannot know that there shall be a Christ.

column2: Alma 30:16 16 Ye look forward and say that ye see a remission of your sins. But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.
column3: Alma thirty to sixteen sixteen Ye look forward and say that ye see a remission of your sins. But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

column2: Alma 30:17 17 And many more such things did he say unto them, telling them that there could be no atonement made for the sins of men, but every man fared in this life according to the management of the creature; therefore every man prospered according to his genius, and that every man conquered according to his strength; and whatsoever a man did was no crime.
column3: Alma thirty to seventeen seventeen And many more such things did he say unto them, telling them that there could be no atonement made for the sins of men, but every man fared in this life according to the management of the creature; therefore every man prospered according to his genius, and that every man conquered according to his strength; and whatsoever a man did was no crime.

column2: Alma 30:18 18 And thus he did preach unto them, leading away the hearts of many, causing them to lift up their heads in their wickedness, yea, leading away many women, and also men, to commit whoredoms--telling them that when a man was dead, that was the end thereof.
column3: Alma thirty to eighteen eighteen And thus he did preach unto them, leading away the hearts of many, causing them to lift up their heads in their wickedness, yea, leading away many women, and also men, to commit whoredoms-telling them that when a man was dead, that was the end thereof.

column2: Alma 30:19 19 Now this man went over to the land of Jershon also, to preach these things among the people of Ammon, who were once the people of the Lamanites.
column3: Alma thirty to nineteen nineteen Now this man went over to the land of Jershon also, to preach these things among the people of Ammon, who were once the people of the Lamanites.

column2: Alma 30:20 20 But behold they were more wise than many of the Nephites; for they took him, and bound him, and carried him before Ammon, who was a high priest over that people.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty twenty But behold they were more wise than many of the Nephites; for they took him, and bound him, and carried him before Ammon, who was a high priest over that people.

column2: Alma 30:21 21 And it came to pass that he caused that he should be carried out of the land.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty one twenty one And it came to pass that he caused that he should be carried out of the land.

column2: And he came over into the land of Gideon, and began to preach unto them also; and here he did not have much success, for he was taken and bound and carried before the high priest, and also the chief judge over the land.
column3: And he came over into the land of Gideon, and began to preach unto them also; and here he did not have much success, for he was taken and bound and carried before the high priest, and also the chief judge over the land.

column2: Alma 30:22 22 And it came to pass that the high priest said unto him: Why do ye go about perverting the ways of the Lord?
column3: Alma thirty to twenty two twenty two And it came to pass that the high priest said unto him: Why do ye go about perverting the ways of the Lord?

column2: Why do ye teach this people that there shall be no Christ, to interrupt their rejoicings?
column3: Why do ye teach this people that there shall be no Christ, to interrupt their rejoicings?

column2: Why do ye speak against all the prophecies of the holy prophets?
column3: Why do ye speak against all the prophecies of the holy prophets?

column2: Alma 30:23 23 Now the high priest's name was Giddonah.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty three twenty three Now the high priest's name was Giddonah.

column2: And Korihor said unto him: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.
column3: And Korihor said unto him: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

column2: Alma 30:24 24 Ye say that this people is a free people.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty four twenty four Ye say that this people is a free people.

column2: Behold, I say they are in bondage.
column3: Behold, I say they are in bondage.

column2: Ye say that those ancient prophecies are true. Behold, I say that ye do not know that they are true.
column3: Ye say that those ancient prophecies are true. Behold, I say that ye do not know that they are true.

column2: Alma 30:25 25 Ye say that this people is a guilty and a fallen people, because of the transgression of a parent.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty five twenty five Ye say that this people is a guilty and a fallen people, because of the transgression of a parent.

column2: Behold, I say that a child is not guilty because of its parents.
column3: Behold, I say that a child is not guilty because of its parents.

column2: Alma 30:26 26 And ye also say that Christ shall come.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty six twenty six And ye also say that Christ shall come.

column2: But behold, I say that ye do not know that there shall be a Christ.
column3: But behold, I say that ye do not know that there shall be a Christ.

column2: And ye say also that he shall be slain for the sins of the world--
column3: And ye say also that he shall be slain for the sins of the world-

column2: Alma 30:27 27 And thus ye lead away this people after the foolish traditions of your fathers, and according to your own desires; and ye keep them down, even as it were in bondage, that ye may glut yourselves with the labors of their hands, that they durst not look up with boldness, and that they durst not enjoy their rights and privileges.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty seven twenty seven And thus ye lead away this people after the foolish traditions of your fathers, and according to your own desires; and ye keep them down, even as it were in bondage, that ye may glut yourselves with the labors of their hands, that they durst not look up with boldness, and that they durst not enjoy their rights and privileges.

column2: Alma 30:28 28 Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God--a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty eight twenty eight Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God-a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.

column2: Alma 30:29 29 Now when the high priest and the chief judge saw the hardness of his heart, yea, when they saw that he would revile even against God, they would not make any reply to his words; but they caused that he should be bound; and they delivered him up into the hands of the officers, and sent him to the land of Zarahemla, that he might be brought before Alma, and the chief judge who was governor over all the land.
column3: Alma thirty to twenty nine twenty nine Now when the high priest and the chief judge saw the hardness of his heart, yea, when they saw that he would revile even against God, they would not make any reply to his words; but they caused that he should be bound; and they delivered him up into the hands of the officers, and sent him to the land of Zarahemla, that he might be brought before Alma, and the chief judge who was governor over all the land.

column2: Alma 30:30 30 And it came to pass that when he was brought before Alma and the chief judge, he did go on in the same manner as he did in the land of Gideon; yea, he went on to blaspheme.
column3: Alma thirty to thirty thirty And it came to pass that when he was brought before Alma and the chief judge, he did go on in the same manner as he did in the land of Gideon; yea, he went on to blaspheme.

column2: Alma 30:31 31 And he did rise up in great swelling words before Alma, and did revile against the priests and teachers, accusing them of leading away the people after the silly traditions of their fathers, for the sake of glutting on the labors of the people.
column3: Alma thirty to thirty one thirty one And he did rise up in great swelling words before Alma, and did revile against the priests and teachers, accusing them of leading away the people after the silly traditions of their fathers, for the sake of glutting on the labors of the people.

column2: Alma 30:32 32 Now Alma said unto him: Thou knowest that we do not glut ourselves upon the labors of this people; for behold I have labored even from the commencement of the reign of the judges until now, with mine own hands for my support, notwithstanding my many travels round about the land to declare the word of God unto my people.
column3: Alma thirty to thirty two thirty two Now Alma said unto him: Thou knowest that we do not glut ourselves upon the labors of this people; for behold I have labored even from the commencement of the reign of the judges until now, with mine own hands for my support, notwithstanding my many travels round about the land to declare the word of God unto my people.

column2: Alma 30:33 33 And notwithstanding the many labors which I have performed in the church, I have never received so much as even one senine for my labor; neither has any of my brethren, save it were in the judgment-seat; and then we have received only according to law for our time.
column3: Alma thirty to thirty three thirty three And notwithstanding the many labors which I have performed in the church, I have never received so much as even one senine for my labor; neither has any of my brethren, save it were in the judgment seat; and then we have received only according to law for our time.

column2: Alma 30:34 34 And now, if we do not receive anything for our labors in the church, what doth it profit us to labor in the church save it were to declare the truth, that we may have rejoicings in the joy of our brethren?
column3: Alma thirty to thirty four thirty four And now, if we do not receive anything for our labors in the church, what doth it profit us to labor in the church save it were to declare the truth, that we may have rejoicings in the joy of our brethren?

column2: Alma 30:35 35 Then why sayest thou that we preach unto this people to get gain, when thou, of thyself, knowest that we receive no gain? And now, believest thou that we deceive this people, that causes such joy in their hearts?
column3: Alma thirty to thirty five thirty five Then why sayest thou that we preach unto this people to get gain, when thou, of thyself, knowest that we receive no gain? And now, believest thou that we deceive this people, that causes such joy in their hearts?

column2: Alma 30:36 36 And Korihor answered him, Yea.
column3: Alma thirty to thirty six thirty six And Korihor answered him, Yea.

column2: Alma 30:37 37 And then Alma said unto him: Believest thou that there is a God?
column3: Alma thirty to thirty seven thirty seven And then Alma said unto him: Believest thou that there is a God?

column2: Alma 30:38 38 And he answered, Nay.
column3: Alma thirty to thirty eight thirty eight And he answered, Nay.

column2: Alma 30:39 39 Now Alma said unto him: Will ye deny again that there is a God, and also deny the Christ?
column3: Alma thirty to thirty nine thirty nine Now Alma said unto him: Will ye deny again that there is a God, and also deny the Christ?

column2: For behold, I say unto you, I know there is a God, and also that Christ shall come.
column3: For behold, I say unto you, I know there is a God, and also that Christ shall come.

column2: Alma 30:40 40 And now what evidence have ye that there is no God, or that Christ cometh not?
column3: Alma thirty to forty forty And now what evidence have ye that there is no God, or that Christ cometh not?

column2: I say unto you that ye have none, save it be your word only.
column3: I say unto you that ye have none, save it be your word only.

column2: Alma 30:41 41 But, behold, I have all things as a testimony that these things are true; and ye also have all things as a testimony unto you that they are true; and will ye deny them?
column3: Alma thirty to forty one forty one But, behold, I have all things as a testimony that these things are true; and ye also have all things as a testimony unto you that they are true; and will ye deny them?

column2: Believest thou that these things are true?
column3: Believest thou that these things are true?

column2: Alma 30:42 42 Behold, I know that thou believest, but thou art possessed with a lying spirit, and ye have put off the Spirit of God that it may have no place in you; but the devil has power over you, and he doth carry you about, working devices that he may destroy the children of God.
column3: Alma thirty to forty two forty two Behold ,I know that thou believest, but thou art possessed with a lying spirit, and ye have put off the Spirit of God that it may have no place in you; but the devil has power over you, and he doth carry you about, working devices that he may destroy the children of God.

column2: Alma 30:43 43 And now Korihor said unto Alma: If thou wilt show me a sign, that I may be convinced that there is a God, yea, show unto me that he hath power, and then will I be convinced of the truth of thy words.
column3: Alma thirty to forty three forty three And now Korihor said unto Alma: If thou wilt show me a sign, that I may be convinced that there is a God, yea, show unto me that he hath power, and then will I be convinced of the truth of thy words.

column2: Alma 30:44 44 But Alma said unto him: Thou hast had signs enough; will ye tempt your God?
column3: Alma thirty to forty four forty four But Alma said unto him: Thou hast had signs enough; will ye tempt your God?

column2: Will ye say, Show unto me a sign, when ye have the testimony of all these thy brethren, and also all the holy prophets?
column3: Will ye say, Show unto me a sign, when ye have the testimony of all these thy brethren, and also all the holy prophets?

column2: The scriptures are laid before thee, yea, and all things denote there is a God; yea, even the earth, and all things that are upon the face of it, yea, and its motion, yea, and also all the planets which move in their regular form do witness that there is a Supreme Creator.
column3: The scriptures are laid before thee, yea, and all things denote there is a God; yea, even the earth, and all things that are upon the face of it, yea, and its motion, yea, and also all the planets which move in their regular form do witness that there is a Supreme Creator.

column2: Alma 30:45 45 And yet do ye go about, leading away the hearts of this people, testifying unto them there is no God?
column3: Alma thirty to forty five forty five And yet do ye go about, leading away the hearts of this people, testifying unto them there is no God?

column2: And yet will ye deny against all these witnesses?
column3: And yet will ye deny against all these witnesses?

column2: And he said: Yea, I will deny, except ye shall show me a sign.
column3: And he said: Yea, I will deny, except ye shall show me a sign.

column2: Alma 30:46 46 And now it came to pass that Alma said unto him: Behold, I am grieved because of the hardness of your heart, yea, that ye will still resist the spirit of the truth, that thy soul may be destroyed.
column3: Alma thirty to forty six forty six And now it came to pass that Alma said unto him: Behold, I am grieved because of the hardness of your heart, yea, that ye will still resist the spirit of the truth, that thy soul may be destroyed.

column2: Alma 30:47 47 But behold, it is better that thy soul should be lost than that thou shouldst be the means of bringing many souls down to destruction, by thy lying and by thy flattering words; therefore if thou shalt deny again, behold God shall smite thee, that thou shalt become dumb, that thou shalt never open thy mouth any more, that thou shalt not deceive this people any more.
column3: Alma thirty to forty seven forty seven But behold, it is better that thy soul should be lost than that thou shouldst be the means of bringing many souls down to destruction, by thy lying and by thy flattering words; therefore if thou shalt deny again, behold God shall smite thee, that thou shalt become dumb, that thou shalt never open thy mouth any more, that thou shalt not deceive this people any more.

column2: Alma 30:48 48 Now Korihor said unto him: I do not deny the existence of a God, but I do not believe that there is a God; and I say also, that ye do not know that there is a God; and except ye show me a sign, I will not believe.
column3: Alma thirty to forty eight forty eight Now Korihor said unto him: I do not deny the existence of a God, but I do not believe that there is a God; and I say also, that ye do not know that there is a God; and except ye show me a sign, I will not believe.

column2: Alma 30:49 49 Now Alma said unto him: This will I give unto thee for a sign, that thou shalt be struck dumb, according to my words; and I say, that in the name of God, ye shall be struck dumb, that ye shall no more have utterance.
column3: Alma thirty to forty nine forty nine Now Alma said unto him: This will I give unto thee for a sign, that thou shalt be struck dumb, according to my words; and I say, that in the name of God, ye shall be struck dumb, that ye shall no more have utterance.

column2: Alma 30:50 50 Now when Alma had said these words, Korihor was struck dumb, that he could not have utterance, according to the words of Alma.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty fifty Now when Alma had said these words, Korihor was struck dumb, that he could not have utterance, according to the words of Alma.

column2: Alma 30:51 51 And now when the chief judge saw this, he put forth his hand and wrote unto Korihor, saying: Art thou convinced of the power of God?
column3: Alma thirty to fifty one fifty one And now when the chief judge saw this, he put forth his hand and wrote unto Korihor, saying: Art thou convinced of the power of God?

column2: In whom did ye desire that Alma should show forth his sign?
column3: In whom did ye desire that Alma should show forth his sign?

column2: Would ye that he should afflict others, to show unto thee a sign?
column3: Would ye that he should afflict others, to show unto thee a sign?

column2: Behold, he has showed unto you a sign; and now will ye dispute more?
column3: Behold, he has showed unto you a sign; and now will ye dispute more?

column2: Alma 30:52 52 And Korihor put forth his hand and wrote, saying: I know that I am dumb, for I cannot speak; and I know that nothing save it were the power of God could bring this upon me; yea, and I always knew that there was a God.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty two fifty two And Korihor put forth his hand and wrote, saying: I know that I am dumb, for I cannot speak; and I know that nothing save it were the power of God could bring this upon me; yea, and I always knew that there was a God.

column2: Alma 30:53 53 But behold, the devil hath deceived me; for he appeared unto me in the form of an angel, and said unto me: Go and reclaim this people, for they have all gone astray after an unknown God.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty three fifty three But behold, the devil hath deceived me; for he appeared unto me in the form of an angel, and said unto me: Go and reclaim this people, for they have all gone astray after an unknown God.

column2: And he said unto me: There is no God; yea, and he taught me that which I should say.
column3: And he said unto me: There is no God; yea, and he taught me that which I should say.

column2: And I have taught his words; and I taught them because they were pleasing unto the carnal mind; and I taught them, even until I had much success, insomuch that I verily believed that they were true; and for this cause I withstood the truth, even until I have brought this great curse upon me.
column3: And I have taught his words; and I taught them because they were pleasing unto the carnal mind; and I taught them, even until I had much success, insomuch that I verily believed that they were true; and for this cause I withstood the truth, even until I have brought this great curse upon me.

column2: Alma 30:54 54 Now when he had said this, he besought that Alma should pray unto God, that the curse might be taken from him.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty four fifty four Now when he had said this, he besought that Alma should pray unto God, that the curse might be taken from him.

column2: Alma 30:55 55 But Alma said unto him: If this curse should be taken from thee thou wouldst again lead away the hearts of this people; therefore, it shall be unto thee even as the Lord will.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty five fifty five But Alma said unto him: If this curse should be taken from thee thou wouldst again lead away the hearts of this people; therefore, it shall be unto thee even as the Lord will.

column2: Alma 30:56 56 And it came to pass that the curse was not taken off of Korihor; but he was cast out, and went about from house to house begging for his food.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty six fifty six And it came to pass that the curse was not taken off of Korihor; but he was cast out, and went about from house to house begging for his food.

column2: Alma 30:57 57 Now the knowledge of what had happened unto Korihor was immediately published throughout all the land; yea, the proclamation was sent forth by the chief judge to all the people in the land, declaring unto those who had believed in the words of Korihor that they must speedily repent, lest the same judgments would come unto them.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty seven fifty seven Now the knowledge of what had happened unto Korihor was immediately published throughout all the land; yea, the proclamation was sent forth by the chief judge to all the people in the land, declaring unto those who had believed in the words of Korihor that they must speedily repent, lest the same judgments would come unto them.

column2: Alma 30:58 58 And it came to pass that they were all convinced of the wickedness of Korihor; therefore they were all converted again unto the Lord; and this put an end to the iniquity after the manner of Korihor.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty eight fifty eight And it came to pass that they were all convinced of the wickedness of Korihor; therefore they were all converted again unto the Lord; and this put an end to the iniquity after the manner of Korihor.

column2: And Korihor did go about from house to house, begging food for his support.
column3: And Korihor did go about from house to house, begging food for his support.

column2: Alma 30:59 59 And it came to pass that as he went forth among the people, yea, among a people who had separated themselves from the Nephites and called themselves Zoramites, being led by a man whose name was Zoram--and as he went forth amongst them, behold, he was run upon and trodden down, even until he was dead.
column3: Alma thirty to fifty nine fifty nine And it came to pass that as he went forth among the people, yea, among a people who had separated themselves from the Nephites and called themselves Zoramites, being led by a man whose name was Zoram-and as he went forth amongst them, behold, he was run upon and trodden down, even until he was dead.

column2: Alma 30:60 60 And thus we see the end of him who perverteth the ways of the Lord; and thus we see that the devil will not support his children at the last day, but doth speedily drag them down to hell.
column3: Alma thirty to sixty sixty And thus we see the end of him who perverteth the ways of the Lord; and thus we see that the devil will not support his children at the last day, but doth speedily drag them down to hell.

column2: Alma 31 Chapter 31
column3: Alma thirty one Chapter thirty one

column2: Alma 31:1 1 Now it came to pass that after the end of Korihor, Alma having received tidings that the Zoramites were perverting the ways of the Lord, and that Zoram, who was their leader, was leading the hearts of the people to bow down to dumb idols, his heart again began to sicken because of the iniquity of the people.
column3: Alma thirty one to one one Now it came to pass that after the end of Korihor, Alma having received tidings that the Zoramites were perverting the ways of the Lord, and that Zoram, who was their leader, was leading the hearts of the people to bow down to dumb idols, his heart again began to sicken because of the iniquity of the people.

column2: Alma 31:2 2 For it was the cause of great sorrow to Alma to know of iniquity among his people; therefore his heart was exceedingly sorrowful because of the separation of the Zoramites from the Nephites.
column3: Alma thirty one to two two For it was the cause of great sorrow to Alma to know of iniquity among his people; therefore his heart was exceedingly sorrowful because of the separation of the Zoramites from the Nephites.

column2: Alma 31:3 3 Now the Zoramites had gathered themselves together in a land which they called Antionum, which was east of the land of Zarahemla, which lay nearly bordering upon the seashore, which was south of the land of Jershon, which also bordered upon the wilderness south, which wilderness was full of the Lamanites.
column3: Alma thirty one to three three Now the Zoramites had gathered themselves together in a land which they called Antionum, which was east of the land of Zarahemla, which lay nearly bordering upon the seashore, which was south of the land of Jershon, which also bordered upon the wilderness south, which wilderness was full of the Lamanites.

column2: Alma 31:4 4 Now the Nephites greatly feared that the Zoramites would enter into a correspondence with the Lamanites, and that it would be the means of great loss on the part of the Nephites.
column3: Alma thirty one to four four Now the Nephites greatly feared that the Zoramites would enter into a correspondence with the Lamanites, and that it would be the means of great loss on the part of the Nephites.

column2: Alma 31:5 5 And now, as the preaching of the word had a great tendency to lead the people to do that which was just--yea, it had had more powerful effect upon the minds of the people than the sword, or anything else, which had happened unto them--therefore Alma thought it was expedient that they should try the virtue of the word of God.
column3: Alma thirty one to five five And now, as the preaching of the word had a great tendency to lead the people to do that which was just-yea, it had had more powerful effect upon the minds of the people than the sword, or anything else, which had happened unto them-therefore Alma thought it was expedient that they should try the virtue of the word of God.

column2: Alma 31:6 6 Therefore he took Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner; and Himni he did leave in the church in Zarahemla; but the former three he took with him, and also Amulek and Zeezrom, who were at Melek; and he also took two of his sons.
column3: Alma thirty one to six six Therefore he took Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner; and Himni he did leave in the church in Zarahemla; but the former three he took with him, and also Amulek and Zeezrom, who were at Melek; and he also took two of his sons.

column2: Alma 31:7 7 Now the eldest of his sons he took not with him, and his name was Helaman; but the names of those whom he took with him were Shiblon and Corianton; and these are the names of those who went with him among the Zoramites, to preach unto them the word.
column3: Alma thirty one to seven seven Now the eldest of his sons he took not with him, and his name was Helaman; but the names of those whom he took with him were Shiblon and Corianton; and these are the names of those who went with him among the Zoramites, to preach unto them the word.

column2: Alma 31:8 8 Now the Zoramites were dissenters from the Nephites; therefore they had had the word of God preached unto them.
column3: Alma thirty one to eight eight Now the Zoramites were dissenters from the Nephites; therefore they had had the word of God preached unto them.

column2: Alma 31:9 9 But they had fallen into great errors, for they would not observe to keep the commandments of God, and his statutes, according to the law of Moses.
column3: Alma thirty one to nine nine But they had fallen into great errors, for they would not observe to keep the commandments of God, and his statutes, according to the law of Moses.

column2: Alma 31:10 10 Neither would they observe the performances of the church, to continue in prayer and supplication to God daily, that they might not enter into temptation.
column3: Alma thirty one to ten ten Neither would they observe the performances of the church, to continue in prayer and supplication to God daily, that they might not enter into temptation.

column2: Alma 31:11 11 Yea, in fine, they did pervert the ways of the Lord in very many instances; therefore, for this cause, Alma and his brethren went into the land to preach the word unto them.
column3: Alma thirty one to eleven eleven Yea, in fine, they did pervert the ways of the Lord in very many instances; therefore, for this cause, Alma and his brethren went into the land to preach the word unto them.

column2: Alma 31:12 12 Now, when they had come into the land, behold, to their astonishment they found that the Zoramites had built synagogues, and that they did gather themselves together on one day of the week, which day they did call the day of the Lord; and they did worship after a manner which Alma and his brethren had never beheld;
column3: Alma thirty one to twelve twelve Now, when they had come into the land, behold, to their astonishment they found that the Zoramites had built synagogues, and that they did gather themselves together on one day of the week, which day they did call the day of the Lord; and they did worship after a manner which Alma and his brethren had never beheld;

column2: Alma 31:13 13 For they had a place built up in the center of their synagogue, a place for standing, which was high above the head, and the top thereof would only admit one person.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirteen thirteen For they had a place built up in the center of their synagogue, a place for standing, which was high above the head, and the top thereof would only admit one person.

column2: Alma 31:14 14 Therefore, whosoever desired to worship must go forth and stand upon the top thereof, and stretch forth his hands towards heaven, and cry with a loud voice, saying:
column3: Alma thirty one to fourteen fourteen Therefore, whosoever desired to worship must go forth and stand upon the top thereof, and stretch forth his hands towards heaven, and cry with a loud voice, saying:

column2: Alma 31:15 15 Holy, holy God; we believe that thou art God, and we believe that thou art holy, and that thou wast a spirit, and that thou art a spirit, and that thou wilt be a spirit forever.
column3: Alma thirty one to fifteen fifteen Holy, holy God; we believe that thou art God, and we believe that thou art holy, and that thou wast a spirit, and that thou art a spirit, and that thou wilt be a spirit forever.

column2: Alma 31:16 16 Holy God, we believe that thou hast separated us from our brethren; and we do not believe in the tradition of our brethren, which was handed down to them by the childishness of their fathers; but we believe that thou hast elected us to be thy holy children; and also thou hast made it known unto us that there shall be no Christ.
column3: Alma thirty one to sixteen sixteen Holy God, we believe that thou hast separated us from our brethren; and we do not believe in the tradition of our brethren, which was handed down to them by the childishness of their fathers; but we believe that thou hast elected us to be thy holy children; and also thou hast made it known unto us that there shall be no Christ.

column2: Alma 31:17 17 But thou art the same yesterday, today, and forever; and thou hast elected us that we shall be saved, whilst all around us are elected to be cast by thy wrath down to hell; for the which holiness, O God, we thank thee; and we also thank thee that thou hast elected us, that we may not be led away after the foolish traditions of our brethren, which doth bind them down to a belief of Christ, which doth lead their hearts to wander far from thee, our God.
column3: Alma thirty one to seventeen seventeen But thou art the same yesterday, today, and forever; and thou hast elected us that we shall be saved, whilst all around us are elected to be cast by thy wrath down to hell; for the which holiness, O God, we thank thee; and we also thank thee that thou hast elected us, that we may not be led away after the foolish traditions of our brethren, which doth bind them down to a belief of Christ, which doth lead their hearts to wander far from thee, our God.

column2: Alma 31:18 18 And again we thank thee, O God, that we are a chosen and a holy people.
column3: Alma thirty one to eighteen eighteen And again we thank thee, O God, that we are a chosen and a holy people.

column2: Amen.
column3: Amen.

column2: Alma 31:19 19 Now it came to pass that after Alma and his brethren and his sons had heard these prayers, they were astonished beyond all measure.
column3: Alma thirty one to nineteen nineteen Now it came to pass that after Alma and his brethren and his sons had heard these prayers, they were astonished beyond all measure.

column2: Alma 31:20 20 For behold, every man did go forth and offer up these same prayers.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty twenty For behold, every man did go forth and offer up these same prayers.

column2: Alma 31:21 21 Now the place was called by them Rameumptom, which, being interpreted, is the holy stand.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty one twenty one Now the place was called by them Rameumptom, which, being interpreted, is the holy stand.

column2: Alma 31:22 22 Now, from this stand they did offer up, every man, the selfsame prayer unto God, thanking their God that they were chosen of him, and that he did not lead them away after the tradition of their brethren, and that their hearts were not stolen away to believe in things to come, which they knew nothing about.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty two twenty two Now, from this stand they did offer up, every man, the selfsame prayer unto God, thanking their God that they were chosen of him, and that he did not lead them away after the tradition of their brethren, and that their hearts were not stolen away to believe in things to come, which they knew nothing about.

column2: Alma 31:23 23 Now, after the people had all offered up thanks after this manner, they returned to their homes, never speaking of their God again until they had assembled themselves together again to the holy stand, to offer up thanks after their manner.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty three twenty three Now, after the people had all offered up thanks after this manner, they returned to their homes, never speaking of their God again until they had assembled themselves together again to the holy stand, to offer up thanks after their manner.

column2: Alma 31:24 24 Now when Alma saw this his heart was grieved; for he saw that they were a wicked and a perverse people; yea, he saw that their hearts were set upon gold, and upon silver, and upon all manner of fine goods.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty four twenty four Now when Alma saw this his heart was grieved; for he saw that they were a wicked and a perverse people; yea, he saw that their hearts were set upon gold, and upon silver, and upon all manner of fine goods.

column2: Alma 31:25 25 Yea, and he also saw that their hearts were lifted up unto great boasting, in their pride.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty five twenty five Yea, and he also saw that their hearts were lifted up unto great boasting, in their pride.

column2: Alma 31:26 26 And he lifted up his voice to heaven, and cried, saying: O, how long, O Lord, wilt thou suffer that thy servants shall dwell here below in the flesh, to behold such gross wickedness among the children of men?
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty six twenty six And he lifted up his voice to heaven, and cried, saying: O, how long, O Lord, wilt thou suffer that thy servants shall dwell here below in the flesh, to behold such gross wickedness among the children of men?

column2: Alma 31:27 27 Behold, O God, they cry unto thee, and yet their hearts are swallowed up in their pride.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty seven twenty seven Behold ,O God, they cry unto thee, and yet their hearts are swallowed up in their pride.

column2: Behold, O God, they cry unto thee with their mouths, while they are puffed up, even to greatness, with the vain things of the world.
column3: Behold, O God, they cry unto thee with their mouths, while they are puffed up, even to greatness, with the vain things of the world.

column2: Alma 31:28 28 Behold, O my God, their costly apparel, and their ringlets, and their bracelets, and their ornaments of gold, and all their precious things which they are ornamented with; and behold, their hearts are set upon them, and yet they cry unto thee and say--We thank thee, O God, for we are a chosen people unto thee, while others shall perish.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty eight twenty eight Behold ,O my God, their costly apparel, and their ringlets, and their bracelets, and their ornaments of gold, and all their precious things which they are ornamented with; and behold, their hearts are set upon them, and yet they cry unto thee and say-We thank thee, O God, for we are a chosen people unto thee, while others shall perish.

column2: Alma 31:29 29 Yea, and they say that thou hast made it known unto them that there shall be no Christ.
column3: Alma thirty one to twenty nine twenty nine Yea, and they say that thou hast made it known unto them that there shall be no Christ.

column2: Alma 31:30 30 O Lord God, how long wilt thou suffer that such wickedness and infidelity shall be among this people?
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty thirty O Lord God, how long wilt thou suffer that such wickedness and infidelity shall be among this people?

column2: O Lord, wilt thou give me strength, that I may bear with mine infirmities.
column3: O Lord, wilt thou give me strength, that I may bear with mine infirmities.

column2: For I am infirm, and such wickedness among this people doth pain my soul.
column3: For I am infirm, and such wickedness among this people doth pain my soul.

column2: Alma 31:31 31 O Lord, my heart is exceedingly sorrowful; wilt thou comfort my soul in Christ. O Lord, wilt thou grant unto me that I may have strength, that I may suffer with patience these afflictions which shall come upon me, because of the iniquity of this people.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty one thirty one O Lord, my heart is exceedingly sorrowful; wilt thou comfort my soul in Christ. O Lord, wilt thou grant unto me that I may have strength, that I may suffer with patience these afflictions which shall come upon me, because of the iniquity of this people.

column2: Alma 31:32 32 O Lord, wilt thou comfort my soul, and give unto me success, and also my fellow laborers who are with me--yea, Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner, and also Amulek and Zeezrom and also my two sons--yea, even all these wilt thou comfort, O Lord.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty two thirty two O Lord, wilt thou comfort my soul, and give unto me success, and also my fellow laborers who are with me-yea, Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner, and also Amulek and Zeezrom and also my two sons-yea, even all these wilt thou comfort, O Lord.

column2: Yea, wilt thou comfort their souls in Christ.
column3: Yea, wilt thou comfort their souls in Christ.

column2: Alma 31:33 33 Wilt thou grant unto them that they may have strength, that they may bear their afflictions which shall come upon them because of the iniquities of this people.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty three thirty three Wilt thou grant unto them that they may have strength, that they may bear their afflictions which shall come upon them because of the iniquities of this people.

column2: Alma 31:34 34 O Lord, wilt thou grant unto us that we may have success in bringing them again unto thee in Christ.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty four thirty four O Lord, wilt thou grant unto us that we may have success in bringing them again unto thee in Christ.

column2: Alma 31:35 35 Behold, O Lord, their souls are precious, and many of them are our brethren; therefore, give unto us, O Lord, power and wisdom that we may bring these, our brethren, again unto thee.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty five thirty five Behold ,O Lord, their souls are precious, and many of them are our brethren; therefore, give unto us, O Lord, power and wisdom that we may bring these, our brethren, again unto thee.

column2: Alma 31:36 36 Now it came to pass that when Alma had said these words, that he clapped his hands upon all them who were with him.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty six thirty six Now it came to pass that when Alma had said these words, that he clapped his hands upon all them who were with him.

column2: And behold, as he clapped his hands upon them, they were filled with the Holy Spirit.
column3: And behold, as he clapped his hands upon them, they were filled with the Holy Spirit.

column2: Alma 31:37 37 And after that they did separate themselves one from another, taking no thought for themselves what they should eat, or what they should drink, or what they should put on.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty seven thirty seven And after that they did separate themselves one from another, taking no thought for themselves what they should eat, or what they should drink, or what they should put on.

column2: Alma 31:38 38 And the Lord provided for them that they should hunger not, neither should they thirst; yea, and he also gave them strength, that they should suffer no manner of afflictions, save it were swallowed up in the joy of Christ.
column3: Alma thirty one to thirty eight thirty eight And the Lord provided for them that they should hunger not, neither should they thirst; yea, and he also gave them strength, that they should suffer no manner of afflictions, save it were swallowed up in the joy of Christ.

column2: Now this was according to the prayer of Alma; and this because he prayed in faith.
column3: Now this was according to the prayer of Alma; and this because he prayed in faith.

column2: Alma 32 Chapter 32
column3: Alma thirty two Chapter thirty two

column2: Alma 32:1 1 And it came to pass that they did go forth, and began to preach the word of God unto the people, entering into their synagogues, and into their houses; yea, and even they did preach the word in their streets.
column3: Alma thirty two to one one And it came to pass that they did go forth, and began to preach the word of God unto the people, entering into their synagogues, and into their houses; yea, and even they did preach the word in their streets.

column2: Alma 32:2 2 And it came to pass that after much labor among them, they began to have success among the poor class of people; for behold, they were cast out of the synagogues because of the coarseness of their apparel--
column3: Alma thirty two to two two And it came to pass that after much labor among them, they began to have success among the poor class of people; for behold, they were cast out of the synagogues because of the coarseness of their apparel-

column2: Alma 32:3 3 Therefore they were not permitted to enter into their synagogues to worship God, being esteemed as filthiness; therefore they were poor; yea, they were esteemed by their brethren as dross; therefore they were poor as to things of the world; and also they were poor in heart.
column3: Alma thirty two to three three Therefore they were not permitted to enter into their synagogues to worship God, being esteemed as filthiness; therefore they were poor; yea, they were esteemed by their brethren as dross; therefore they were poor as to things of the world; and also they were poor in heart.

column2: Alma 32:4 4 Now, as Alma was teaching and speaking unto the people upon the hill Onidah, there came a great multitude unto him, who were those of whom we have been speaking, of whom were poor in heart, because of their poverty as to the things of the world.
column3: Alma thirty two to four four Now, as Alma was teaching and speaking unto the people upon the hill Onidah, there came a great multitude unto him, who were those of whom we have been speaking, of whom were poor in heart, because of their poverty as to the things of the world.

column2: Alma 32:5 5 And they came unto Alma; and the one who was the foremost among them said unto him: Behold, what shall these my brethren do, for they are despised of all men because of their poverty, yea, and more especially by our priests; for they have cast us out of our synagogues which we have labored abundantly to build with our own hands; and they have cast us out because of our exceeding poverty; and we have no place to worship our God; and behold, what shall we do?
column3: Alma thirty two to five five And they came unto Alma; and the one who was the foremost among them said unto him: Behold, what shall these my brethren do, for they are despised of all men because of their poverty, yea, and more especially by our priests; for they have cast us out of our synagogues which we have labored abundantly to build with our own hands; and they have cast us out because of our exceeding poverty; and we have no place to worship our God; and behold, what shall we do?

column2: Alma 32:6 6 And now when Alma heard this, he turned him about, his face immediately towards him, and he beheld with great joy; for he beheld that their afflictions had truly humbled them and that they were in a preparation to hear the word.
column3: Alma thirty two to six six And now when Alma heard this, he turned him about, his face immediately towards him, and he beheld with great joy; for he beheld that their afflictions had truly humbled them and that they were in a preparation to hear the word.

column2: Alma 32:7 7 Therefore he did say no more to the other multitude; but he stretched forth his hand, and cried unto those whom he beheld, who were truly penitent, and said unto them:
column3: Alma thirty two to seven seven Therefore he did say no more to the other multitude; but he stretched forth his hand, and cried unto those whom he beheld, who were truly penitent, and said unto them:

column2: Alma 32:8 8 I behold that ye are lowly in heart; and if so, blessed are ye.
column3: Alma thirty two to eight eight I behold that ye are lowly in heart; and if so, blessed are ye.

column2: Alma 32:9 9 Behold thy brother hath said, What shall we do?--for we are cast out of our synagogues, that we cannot worship our God.
column3: Alma thirty two to nine nine Behold thy brother hath said, What shall we do?--for we are cast out of our synagogues, that we cannot worship our God.

column2: Alma 32:10 10 Behold I say unto you, do ye suppose that ye cannot worship God save it be in your synagogues only?
column3: Alma thirty two to ten ten Behold I say unto you, do ye suppose that ye cannot worship God save it be in your synagogues only?

column2: Alma 32:11 11 Moreover, I would ask, do ye suppose that ye must not worship God only once in a week?
column3: Alma thirty two to eleven eleven Moreover ,I would ask, do ye suppose that ye must not worship God only once in a week?

column2: Alma 32:12 12 I say unto you, it is well that ye are cast out of your synagogues, that ye may be humble, and that ye may learn wisdom; for it is necessary that ye should learn wisdom; for it is because that ye are cast out, that ye are despised of your brethren because of your exceeding poverty, that ye are brought to a lowliness of heart; for ye are necessarily brought to be humble.
column3: Alma thirty two to twelve twelve I say unto you, it is well that ye are cast out of your synagogues, that ye may be humble, and that ye may learn wisdom; for it is necessary that ye should learn wisdom; for it is because that ye are cast out, that ye are despised of your brethren because of your exceeding poverty, that ye are brought to a lowliness of heart; for ye are necessarily brought to be humble.

column2: Alma 32:13 13 And now, because ye are compelled to be humble blessed are ye; for a man sometimes, if he is compelled to be humble, seeketh repentance; and now surely, whosoever repenteth shall find mercy; and he that findeth mercy and endureth to the end the same shall be saved.
column3: Alma thirty two to thirteen thirteen And now, because ye are compelled to be humble blessed are ye; for a man sometimes, if he is compelled to be humble, seeketh repentance; and now surely, whosoever repenteth shall find mercy; and he that findeth mercy and endureth to the end the same shall be saved.

column2: Alma 32:14 14 And now, as I said unto you, that because ye were compelled to be humble ye were blessed, do ye not suppose that they are more blessed who truly humble themselves because of the word?
column3: Alma thirty two to fourteen fourteen And now, as I said unto you, that because ye were compelled to be humble ye were blessed, do ye not suppose that they are more blessed who truly humble themselves because of the word?

column2: Alma 32:15 15 Yea, he that truly humbleth himself, and repenteth of his sins, and endureth to the end, the same shall be blessed--yea, much more blessed than they who are compelled to be humble because of their exceeding poverty.
column3: Alma thirty two to fifteen fifteen Yea, he that truly humbleth himself, and repenteth of his sins, and endureth to the end, the same shall be blessed-yea, much more blessed than they who are compelled to be humble because of their exceeding poverty.

column2: Alma 32:16 16 Therefore, blessed are they who humble themselves without being compelled to be humble; or rather, in other words, blessed is he that believeth in the word of God, and is baptized without stubbornness of heart, yea, without being brought to know the word, or even compelled to know, before they will believe.
column3: Alma thirty two to sixteen sixteen Therefore, blessed are they who humble themselves without being compelled to be humble; or rather, in other words, blessed is he that believeth in the word of God, and is baptized without stubbornness of heart, yea, without being brought to know the word, or even compelled to know, before they will believe.

column2: Alma 32:17 17 Yea, there are many who do say: If thou wilt show unto us a sign from heaven, then we shall know of a surety; then we shall believe.
column3: Alma thirty two to seventeen seventeen Yea, there are many who do say: If thou wilt show unto us a sign from heaven, then we shall know of a surety; then we shall believe.

column2: Alma 32:18 18 Now I ask, is this faith?
column3: Alma thirty two to eighteen eighteen Now I ask, is this faith?

column2: Behold, I say unto you, Nay; for if a man knoweth a thing he hath no cause to believe, for he knoweth it.
column3: Behold, I say unto you, Nay; for if a man knoweth a thing he hath no cause to believe, for he knoweth it.

column2: Alma 32:19 19 And now, how much more cursed is he that knoweth the will of God and doeth it not, than he that only believeth, or only hath cause to believe, and falleth into transgression?
column3: Alma thirty two to nineteen nineteen And now, how much more cursed is he that knoweth the will of God and doeth it not, than he that only believeth, or only hath cause to believe, and falleth into transgression?

column2: Alma 32:20 20 Now of this thing ye must judge.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty twenty Now of this thing ye must judge.

column2: Behold, I say unto you, that it is on the one hand even as it is on the other; and it shall be unto every man according to his work.
column3: Behold, I say unto you, that it is on the one hand even as it is on the other; and it shall be unto every man according to his work.

column2: Alma 32:21 21 And now as I said concerning faith--faith is not to have a perfect knowledge of things; therefore if ye have faith ye hope for things which are not seen, which are true.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty one twenty one And now as I said concerning faith-faith is not to have a perfect knowledge of things; therefore if ye have faith ye hope for things which are not seen, which are true.

column2: Alma 32:22 22 And now, behold, I say unto you, and I would that ye should remember, that God is merciful unto all who believe on his name; therefore he desireth, in the first place, that ye should believe, yea, even on his word.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty two twenty two And now, behold, I say unto you, and I would that ye should remember, that God is merciful unto all who believe on his name; therefore he desireth, in the first place, that ye should believe, yea, even on his word.

column2: Alma 32:23 23 And now, he imparteth his word by angels unto men, yea, not only men but women also.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty three twenty three And now, he imparteth his word by angels unto men, yea, not only men but women also.

column2: Now this is not all; little children do have words given unto them many times which confound the wise and the learned.
column3: Now this is not all; little children do have words given unto them many times which confound the wise and the learned.

column2: Alma 32:24 24 And now, my beloved brethren, as ye have desired to know of me what ye shall do because ye are afflicted and cast out--now I do not desire that ye should suppose that I mean to judge you only according to that which is true--
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty four twenty four And now, my beloved brethren, as ye have desired to know of me what ye shall do because ye are afflicted and cast out-now I do not desire that ye should suppose that I mean to judge you only according to that which is true-

column2: Alma 32:25 25 For I do not mean that ye all of you have been compelled to humble yourselves; for I verily believe that there are some among you who would humble themselves, let them be in whatsoever circumstances they might.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty five twenty five For I do not mean that ye all of you have been compelled to humble yourselves; for I verily believe that there are some among you who would humble themselves, let them be in whatsoever circumstances they might.

column2: Alma 32:26 26 Now, as I said concerning faith--that it was not a perfect knowledge--even so it is with my words.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty six twenty six Now, as I said concerning faith-that it was not a perfect knowledge-even so it is with my words.

column2: Ye cannot know of their surety at first, unto perfection, any more than faith is a perfect knowledge.
column3: Ye cannot know of their surety at first, unto perfection, any more than faith is a perfect knowledge.

column2: Alma 32:27 27 But behold, if ye will awake and arouse your faculties, even to an experiment upon my words, and exercise a particle of faith, yea, even if ye can no more than desire to believe, let this desire work in you, even until ye believe in a manner that ye can give place for a portion of my words.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty seven twenty seven But behold, if ye will awake and arouse your faculties, even to an experiment upon my words, and exercise a particle of faith, yea, even if ye can no more than desire to believe, let this desire work in you, even until ye believe in a manner that ye can give place for a portion of my words.

column2: Alma 32:28 28 Now, we will compare the word unto a seed.
column3: Alma thirty two to twenty eight twenty eight Now, we will compare the word unto a seed.

column2: Now, if ye give place, that a seed may be planted in your heart, behold, if it be a true seed, or a good seed, if ye do not cast it out by your unbelief, that ye will resist the Spirit of the Lord, behold, it will begin to swell within your breasts; and when you feel these swelling motions, ye will begin to say within yourselves--It must needs be that this is a good seed, or that the word is good, for it beginneth to enlarge my soul; yea, it beginneth to enlighten my understanding, yea, it beginneth to be delicious to me.
column3: Now, if ye give place, that a seed may be planted in your heart, behold, if it be a true seed, or a good seed, if ye do not cast it out by your unbelief, that ye will resist the Spirit of the Lord, behold, it will begin to swell within your breasts; and when you feel these swelling motions, ye will begin to say within yourselves-It must needs be that this is a good seed, or that the word is good, for it beginneth to enlarge my soul; yea, it beginneth to enlighten my understanding, yea, it beginneth to be delicious to me.
